intro: Gilia acerosa, commonly known as the sharpleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gilia acerosa thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
